alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 5:01AM EDT until June 20 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory Remains in Effect for Floyd and Western Franklin Counties... ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and west central Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Floyd. In west central Virginia, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Rapid rises on small creeks and streams can be expected. Flooding in low-lying and normally flood prone areas is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 459 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain continues across the Advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen just since midnight. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is likely over the next couple of hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dodd Creek, Big Chestnut Creek, Grassy Fork, Lick Fork, Little Creek, Blackwater River, Hatchet Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Coles Creek, Little Chestnut Creek and Boothe Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in an increased threat for flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Floyd... Ferrum... Copper Hill... Callaway... Endicott... Check... - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
